Image of the title THE STORY OF MISS MOPPET
Water-color illustration of the Kitten with a pink ribbon around her neck Text Page.
THIS is a Pussy called Miss Moppet, she thinks she has heard a mouse! Text Page.

THIS is the Mouse peeping out behind the cupboard, and making fun of Miss Moppet. He is not afraid of a kitten. Water-color illustration of mouse peeking from behind a door. He wears a green petticoat. Water-color illustration of the kitten leaping to get at the mouse Text Page.
THIS is Miss Moppet jumping just too late; she misses the Mouse and hits her own head. Text Page.

SHE thinks it is a very hard cupboard! Water-color illustration of kitten rubbing its nose and the mouse teasing it. Water-color illustration of the mouse sitting on top of a cupboard looking down at the cat Text Page.
THE Mouse watches Miss Moppet from the top of the cupboard. Text Page.
MISS MOPPET ties up her head in a duster, and sits before the fire. Water-color illustration of the kitten with a duster bag on her head Text Page.

THE Mouse thinks she is looking very ill. He comes sliding down the bell- pull. Water-color illustration of the mouse climbing down a red bell-pull Water-color illustration of the mouse sneaking up on the cat from behind Text Page.
MISS MOPPET looks worse and worse. The Mouse comes a little nearer. Water-color illustration of the kitten peaking through the duster at the mouse Text Page.
MISS MOPPET holds her poor head in her paws, and looks at him through a hole in the duster. The Mouse comes very close. Text Page.

AND then all of a sudden —Miss Moppet jumps upon the Mouse! Water-color illustration of the kitten surprising the mouse and catching it by the tail Water-color illustration of the kitten wrapping the mouse in the duster Text page.
AND because the Mouse has teased Miss Moppet —Miss Moppet thinks she will tease the Mouse; which is not at all nice of Miss Moppet. Text Page.
SHE ties him up in the duster, and tosses it about like a ball. Water-color illustration of the kitten throwing up the duster and the mouse in the ball. Text page.

BUT she forgot about that hole in the duster; and when she untied it—there was no Mouse! Water-color illustration of the kitten looking into the empty duster with the hole in it. Water-color illustration of the mouse relieved to be free and dancing. Text page.
HE has wriggled out and run away; and he is dancing a jig on the top of the cupboard!
